Text.Page: Fraya, commander of Allemantheia's forces and Kaidun's lover, sent you to Acarum to find out what or who was behind the rebel army attacking there. While it seemed to be Kaidun himself leading the attacks, Fraya believed someone else was inciting rebellion. You discovered strange controller crystals embedded in the rebels' necks. Using those crystals, you obtained an antidote to remove the curse from Kaidun's henchman, Ghufran, who informed you that the real Kaidun was dragged away by Thulsa. The man people believed was Kaidun was actually Thulsa's servant in disguise. By killing him, you proved Kaidun's innocence.

Mission Orders

Return to Allemantheia headquarters immediately for reassignment.

—Fraya

Ah, ! Good of you to come so quickly. As much as you've done for the federation, I need you to do something more.

You must understand, , the federation is my first responsibility, then proud Allemantheia.

What I must ask you to do, neither the federation nor Allemantheia will appreciate, but it is a...debt I owe. You must trust my words. You must not tell a soul.

The elders suspect Kaidun, a commander in Westonia, has rebelled and seized the power of the Core for himself. The Kaidun I know would never do such a thing. But our...relationship colors that sentiment. The elders of Allemantheia will not listen to me. Especially since Kaidun is amani.

If I am wrong, I will lead my army against him myself. But I know in my heart of hearts he is innocent."How can I help?"
Take the pegasus to Acarum. That's as near to the rebellion as you can safely fly. The Mysterium agent there, Harule, is trustworthy. She will help you find the evidence we need.

Kaidun might not have been a traitor, but the army seems to be his, and we can't just ignore that.

Several of Kaidun's former soldiers live here in Acarum. Maybe they'll have some insight."What about the other villagers?"

A fine plan. The more input the better.

Keep warm and good luck. I hope you get more out of them than I have.
Traitor! Kaidun the traitor! He fooled us all into thinking him a hero while he plotted this rebellion. Now his army brings chaos and death!

Yes, I was once one of Kaidun's soldiers. He was an excellent leader, worthy of respect.

For that reason, I would make the traitor's death quick and painless. Out of respect for who he was, of course.

I can't believe General Kaidun is leading the rebel army. Sure, it looks like Kaidun's army. There are similarities.

But those rebels...there's something strange about them. Something...wrong.

It doesn't matter whether it's Kaidun's army or not. Why won't Allemantheia Headquarters deal with the rebels once and for all?

They're killing us. They killed my family!

Sounds familiar. Well, at least you're up to speed now. It's not exactly a tea party out here.

We've killed a few of them, but they've killed a lot more of us. If we don't do something decisive soon, this whole area will lose trust in federation forces, and Allemantheia will not take well to it."Can I see the rebels' corpses?"

To see what's so "wrong" about them? Not a bad plan. Investigate the bodies and report back with anything you find.

First, make a few more corpses out of the Sihran {@LinkCreature:32#1#fighters} and {@LinkCreature:32#3#berserkers} at Daunting Pass on Mount Tyrannas; they'll impede your progress. It might give these people a little peace of mind as well.
(A strange crystal, emanating an eerie light, is embedded in the corpse's neck.)
(A strange crystal, emanating an eerie light, is embedded in the corpse's neck.)
(A strange crystal, emanating an eerie light, is embedded in the corpse's neck.)
(A strange crystal, emanating an eerie light, is embedded in the corpse's neck.)

You found these crystals embedded in their necks? Well, I'll be damned. Someone's controlling them!

Take these to Nania, the Mysterium arcanist at the watchpost.

If anyone can help us, she can. But remember—don't say anything about Fraya.
Have you found anything yet?

You found these where? Odd. We usually find them lodged in the brain.

Reversing the effect is possible, but it's not a simple thing. Four crystals will be enough to break the effect on one person."That will have to do."
All right then. I'll have to ask you to step back. This will take a moment.
What's going on?

It's weak—that happens when you rush things. Wear down your victim before you use it—that will help break the hold.

Might I suggest a target?

Ghufran was Kaidun's best soldier. He's even bigger now, thanks to Sihran magic, but I think you can take him, and he'll have real information."Where do I find him?"

{@LinkCreature:32#16#Ghufran} will be deep inside the rebel army encampment.

Remember, the potion will work best if he's badly injured and exhausted.

Good luck.

I...what? Was that a dream?

No? Oh...oh Kaia!

Please...I don't want to fall under that spell again. Take me to the Redoubt.

Please. I have to lie down for a while.
We left Allemantheia in search of the Core. We were captured—Kaidun, too—and put under Thulsa's curse.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"So Kaidun is being controlled?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Thulsa took the real Kaidun. I don't know where. {@LinkCreature:32#17#"Kaidun" the Tyrant} over at Mount Tyrannas is really Thulsa's servant, Natharkan, wearing Kaidun's armor.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What can we do?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

The only way to clear Kaidun's name is to take down the imposter and make sure everyone knows it isn't Kaidun. Kill Natharkan and bring back his head.

We need to prove it's not really Kaidun who's been making war.

Then we find Kaidun and rescue him.

What's that you're holding? Did you waste my potion and cut Ghufran's head off?!

Oh...no. That's not Kaidun! I knew it!

I mean, it didn't seem likely that Kaidun would betray us. Take the head to Harule in Acarum. Quickly!
Have you gone yet? How did it go?

Fraya was right! Oh, that's such a relief!

Show that around so we can clear Kaidun's name as quickly as possible!

Fraya will also want to hear about this! Show her as soon as you've cleared Kaidun's name.
Kaidun isn't a traitor? Can you prove it?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Look at this."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Whoa. I, uh...a head, huh? Well. So...there that is. Right there. In your hands.

Okay. I got it. Wasn't Kaidun.

I'm just gonna...walk over there now.

I heard you got to Kaidun before I could.

Wait, what do you mean it wasn't Kaidun?"It was this guy."
One of Thulsa's servants. Hmm...but where did he get Kaidun's armor? Do you think the general is still alive?

I knew it! I knew something strange was happening.

Where did the imposter go?"Right here."
Well, that seems unnecessary. But at least we have proof it wasn't Kaidun now! Fraya will be pleased.

So? What do I care about Kaidun's honor? Those rebels killed my family, whoever was leading them, and there ain't nobody's head going to change that.

And it's not going to change the fact these rebels are killing villagers left and right."I know. We're doing what we can."

That's not good enough, is it? Doing the best you can doesn't stop anyone from dying.

Let Allemantheia know we need a reinforcement army!
There was never any doubt in my mind. Thank you for proving his innocence and restoring his honor.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What about the other rebels?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Support from the Mysterium is critical if we're going to clear them out.

If the crystals are as powerful as you say, we cannot save them.

But that is the duty of a soldier. You must be willing to give your life to prevent others from suffering.
